title: August 2018 Android Security Bulletin Partner Preview

vulnerabilities.tech_details: The vulnerability is in the msm_buf_mngr_subdev_ioctl function of msm_generic_buf_mgr.c. The specific flaw is that in the MSM_CAMERA_BUF_MNGR_IOCTL_ID_GET_BUF_BY_IDX handler, a pointer was being taken from user provided data, resulting in kernel memory corruption.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to no longer use user provided data as a write pointer.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ipa_wwan_ioctl and ipa3_wwan_ioctl of rmnet_ipa.c, there is a possible bypass of privileged ioctl filtering due to a missing permission check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a permission check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In onAttachFragment of ShareIntentActivity.java, there is a possible permissions bypass due to a confused deputy. This could lead to local information disclosure reading from files that the AOSP Messenger has access to with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent sending using file URIs.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ResStringPool::string8At of ResourceTypes.cpp, there is a possible exception due to a lack of validation on input data.  This could lead to local denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to reject strings that are not null terminated in ResStringPool::string8At.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the bluetooth pairing dialog, there is a possible permissions bypass due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote information disclosure if a device name is too long or has newlines, sending contacts over bluetooth with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to change the text so the device name is no longer displayed.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ih264d_video_decode of ih264d_api.c there is a possible resource exhaustion due to an infinite loop. This could lead to remote temporary device denial of service (remote hang or reboot) with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure that the decoder returns IV_FAIL in flush mode when it has no buffers to display.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In tftp_send_first of tftp.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure when an app using libcurl sends data to a tftp address with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to update libcurl from 7.54.1 to 7.55.1.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several places, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the entire FW memory dump feature to avoid this and other use after frees.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In Attachment of Attachment.java and getFilePath of EmlAttachmentProvider.java, there is a possible Elevation of Privilege due to a path traversal error. This could lead to a remote escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to filter attachment file names.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In endCallForSubscriber of PhoneInterfaceManager.java, there is a possible ability to hang up an emergency phone call due to a permissions bypass. This could lead to local denial of service if calling an emergency number using the normal dialer (not the emergency dialer) with User execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a permissions check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In limComputeCrc32 of limSecurityUtils.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a buffer overflow.  This could lead to remote arbitrary code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use an appropriate type for a length value.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In laf_cmd_read_proc, there is a possible arbitrary file read due to a missing input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to update the bootloader to add input validation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In task_get_unused_fd_flags of binder.c, there is a possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to always use get_files_struct() to obtain struct_files and avoid use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In computeFocusedWindow of RootWindowContainer.java, and related functions, there is possible interception of keypresses due to focus being on the wrong window. This could lead to local escalation of privilege revealing the user's keypresses while the screen was locked with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to prevent secondary display focus while keyguard is up.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In onCheckedChanged of BluetoothPairingController.java, there is a possible way to retrieve contact information due to a permissions bypass. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to change the contact sharing default and replace newlines in the device name.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In csr_update_fils_params_rso of csr_api_roam.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate validation to avoid the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_lsm_ioctl of msm-lsm-client.c, there is a possible leak of uninitialized data over a netlink socket. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use kzmalloc to initialize the memory in order to avoid the information disclosure.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_fd_private_ioctl of msm_fd_dev.c, there is a possible leak of uninitialized data from the kernel heap. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use vzmalloc to initialize the memory in order to avoid the information disclosure.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In sdp_copy_raw_data of sdp_discovery.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to apply the correct bounds checks when determining the length of data to copy.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In CopyToOMX of OMXNodeInstance.cpp there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to remote arbitrary code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to avoid the out-of-bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In parse of M3UParser.cpp there is a possible resource exhaustion due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to reduce memory use by creating URL objects on demand.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In size_entry_mwt of ebtables.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add checks to make sure the offsets are not out of bounds.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In sdpu_extract_attr_seq of sdp_utils.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to decrease the length after reading from the array.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In sdpu_extract_attr_seq of sdp_utils.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to recalculate param_len when necessary.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_vidc_setup_context_bank of msm_vidc_res_parse.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to an improperly typed variable.  This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to change the type of a variable to avoid the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __remove_nid_from_list of node.c, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to make operations atomic to avoid the race condition.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_add_key of wlan_hdd_cfg80211.c, there is improperly used crypto. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to propagate the key sequence counter to SME.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In bnep_data_ind of bnep_main.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the out-of-bounds access in packet reading.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In avdt_msg_prs_cfg of avdt_msg.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate buffer length validation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In sw49408_irq_runtime_engine_debug of touch_sw49408.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to change the destination buffer to be the right size for the memcpy.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In store_cmd of ftm4_pdc.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use sizeof instead of ARRAY_SIZE.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In getOffsetForHorizontal of Layout.java, there is a possible application hang due to a slow width calculation.  This could lead to remote denial of service if a contact with many hidden unicode characters were sent to the device and used by a local app, with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix performance of the width calculation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: When a device connects only over WiFi VPN, the device may not receive security updates due to some incorrect checks. This could lead to a local denial of service of security updates with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the checks that prevented connectivity over WiFi VPN.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In getstring of ID3.cpp there is a possible out-of-bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a check for zero, preventing the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In bnep_data_ind of bnep_main.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to fix the out-of-bounds access.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __unregister_prot_hook and packet_release of af_packet.c, there is a possible use-after-free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In cleanup_stats of lpm-stats.c, there is a possible heap memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct list handling in cleanup_stats.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In diagchar_open of diagchar_core.c, there is a possible heap memory corruption due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct locking in diagchar_open.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In sde_rot_evtlog_dump_read of sde_rotator_debug.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the input length.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In multiple functions of p_256_ecc_pp.cc, p_256_ecc_pp.h, smp_act.cc, stack_smp_test.cc, there is a possible man-in-the-middle attack due to improperly used crypto. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate remote elliptic curve points.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_vdev_stop_resp_handler of wma_dev_if.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check that the vdev_id is not out of bounds.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mdss_xlog_dump_read of mdss_debug_xlog.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the bounds of the input.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_unified_radio_tx_power_level_stats_event_handler of wma_utils.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to appropriately bounds check data coming from the firmware.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mdss_dsi_cmd_state_read of mdss_dsi.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to properly check that the copy_to_user will not write out of bounds.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In DynamicRefTable::load of ResourceTypes.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the resource table header.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In avrc_proc_vendor_command of avrc_api.cc, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to avoid improper reuse of a buffer.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In gatt_process_error_rsp of gatt_cl.cc, there is a possible out of bound read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In process_service_search_attr_rsp of sdp_discovery.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In avct_bcb_msg_ind of avct_bcb_act.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a header length check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In onCreate of EmergencyCallbackModeExitDialog.java, there is a possible crash due to a missing null check. This could lead to local denial of service of phone calls with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a null check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In smp_br_state_machine_event of smp_br_main.cc, there is a possible out of bounds write due to memory corruption. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate p_cb->role in smp_br_state_machine_event.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In readMetadata of Utils.cpp, there is a possible path traversal bug due to a confused deputy. This could lead to local escalation of privilege when mounting a USB device with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correctly escape quote characters in safe_print and require quote characters when searching for blkid keys.
